The **pit fiend**, &, is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") with two weapon attacks and a crushing grab attack; like all major demons, it has [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and immunity to death magic.

Pit fiends generate [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM") when falling into [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit") or [spiked pits](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), which they share with [pit vipers](/wiki/Pit_viper "Pit viper").[\[1\]](#cite_note-dotrap-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-mintrap-2)

## Generation

Pit fiends are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and are also a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"). Pit fiends are also eligible for [gating](/wiki/Gating "Gating") by other major demons, and may appear as the [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of a chaotic [god](/wiki/God "God").

Three pit fiends each are generated on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth") and [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire").

## Strategy

Pit fiends are especially perilous if you encounter them earlier than normal due to shapeshifters or polymorph traps; their natural -3 AC can make escaping one difficult if it grabs you. They are quite slow at 6 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") however, however - [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") can be useful to drive them off and kite them, and you can also teleport yourself if grabbed, allowing you to escape or else prepare a means of fighting back (e.g. with a [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold") or [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") weapon).

In Gehennom where they normally occur, they are not as much of a threat - most players at this point will have a silver weapon or two, a few methods to deal cold damage, and better AC themselves along with a much more reliable hit-rate.

## History

The pit fiend is introduced alongside many other major demons in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

The pit fiend originates from the 1st edition of *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where it is a type of greater devil that primarily occupies the ninth and deepest layer of hell.

Originating as the personal servants of [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus"), pit fiends were the most powerful of the non-unique devils and acted as elite overseers of Hell itself. They were hulking, scale-armored humanoids with a pair of massive bat-like wings, fearsome claws, venomous fangs, and prehensile tails - pit fiends fought using these natural abilities alongside others that included cloaking themselves in flames or an aura of fear, turning themselves invisible, and various forms of creating and manipulating flame. A pit fiend was tyrannical and narcissistic: they were capable of cunning beyond measure and expert at terrifying lesser devils and mortals alike, though they were also prone to hubris and could not conceive the possibility of failure. Pit fiends could surpass their already mountainous power with training, and the greatest were promoted beyond the normal ranks into dukes, a unique form of devil with its own special abilities.

Pit fiends were made from worthy [ice devils](/wiki/Ice_devil "Ice devil") or [erinyes](/wiki/Erinyes "Erinyes") who were subjected to the devil-scorching hellfire of the Pit of Flame for 1,001 days. Others could be created through the blood of Asmodeus himself: each drop became a greater devil, most often a pit fiend, and such beings had a fanatical loyalty to Asmodeus; they could also spawn lesser devils from their shed blood as well. The Dark Eight was a coven of pit fiend generals who directed Hell's armies and culture, and were in turn kept in line by Asmodeus and the other archdevils.

## Messages

- How pitiful. Isn't that the pits?

  You saw a pit fiend fall into a pit, or fell into one while polymorphed into a pit fiend.[\[1\]](#cite_note-dotrap-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-mintrap-2)

## Variants

### Lethe patch

In the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"), [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")'s lair in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\)#Demogorgon.27s_lair "Gehennom (Lethe patch)") has four pit fiends - one next to Demogorgon's [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne"), two others within the fortress, and the fourth guarding the down [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair").

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), pit fiends may be generated as tame minions for a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") player at [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 28 to 30 via [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") or [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer").

A pit fiend named Hilvuuloth appears among the assistants of [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/One-eyed_Sam_\(SLASH%27EM\) "One-eyed Sam (SLASH'EM)").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), a pit fiend named Hilvuuloth is one of the assistants of [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/One-eyed_Sam_\(UnNetHack\) "One-eyed Sam (UnNetHack)"), as with SLASH'EM.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), pit fiends are commander-rank demons that appear in various lairs all over Gehennom, and generate with huge [tridents](/wiki/Trident "Trident"). The pit fiend's second weapon attack is replaced with a claw attack, and instead of a grabbing attack it has a spellcasting attack and a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") bite that reduces strength.

dNetHack adds a stronger variant in the [Nessian pit fiend](/wiki/Nessian_pit_fiend "Nessian pit fiend"), which also has a passive attack that deals fire damage to melee attackers - they are the second-strongest non-unique demons in the game. Nessian pit fiends generate with maces and battle-axes, and primarily appear in [Nessus](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus").

Eight pit fiends known as the Ashmadia (singular "Ashmade") accompany [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") within his court alongside a Nessian pit fiend known as Asemadeva, the Ninth Ashmade; Asmodeus can also form pit fiends and other demons from his shed blood, although pit fiends will only appear once he has taken very heavy damage. A single "traitor" Nessian pit fiend also appears in the court of Demogorgon within [his palace](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine_Flats#Demogorgon.27s_palace "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats"), and [Mammon](/wiki/Mammon "Mammon") can take the form of a "green pit fiend".

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), pit fiends are given a single claw attack and a new pit-creation attack in order to "live up to their name".[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Fourk also adds more pit-based puns to the game's message output.

The pit fiend's new attack creates several pits around the target, always including one directly under them; if a square selected for pit creation already has one, it will become a [hole](/wiki/Hole "Hole"). Most types of non-floor [terrain](/wiki/Terrain "Terrain"), dungeon features and some kinds of existing traps are exempt from pit creation. Among other things, this makes wielding [footrice](/wiki/Footrice "Footrice") [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") much more dangerous around pit fiends without [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), a different type of pit-creation attack inspired by Fourk is given to pit fiends, replacing their grabbing attack from vanilla.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) The attack has them stomp the ground to create a pit right under you, then grab and throw you into it; if the attempt to create a pit fails (usually due to the square in question being ineligible), the pit fiend "looks rather piteous".

Preexisting pits may rarely turn into holes; while the attack only works on "normal" terrain types, preexisting traps generally do not block the attack. Levitating or flying does not block the attack either, but you will avoid any damage taken from the pit itself and immediately float out of it.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the pit fiend's base experience is adjusted, and they now have a slightly higher speed of 9. Pit fiends in EvilHack can also stomp to create pits, with the implementation borrowed from xNetHack; pit creation occurs randomly 1⁄2 of the time, with the damage increased to 4d4.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

The second-tier demon lord [Mephistopheles](/wiki/Mephistopheles "Mephistopheles") has a pit fiend among his servants if he appears in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM changes, the [Undertaker quest](/index.php?title=Undertaker_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Undertaker quest (page does not exist)") in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") has pit fiends as the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster.

## Encyclopedia entry

Pit fiends are among the more powerful of devils, capable of  
attacking twice with weapons as well as grabbing and crushing  
the life out of those unwary enough to enter their  
domains.

Pit fiends generate [[YAFM]] when falling into [[pit]]s or [[spiked pit]]s, which they share with [[pit viper]]s.{{refsrc|src/trap.c|1226|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name=dotrap}}{{refsrc|src/trap.c|2469|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name=mintrap}}

==Generation==
Pit fiends are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and are also a valid form for normal [[polymorph]]. Pit fiends are also eligible for [[gating]] by other major demons, and may appear as the [[minion]] of a chaotic [[god]].

Three pit fiends each are generated on the [[Plane of Earth]] and [[Plane of Fire]].

==Strategy==
Pit fiends are especially perilous if you encounter them earlier than normal due to shapeshifters or polymorph traps; their natural -3 AC can make escaping one difficult if it grabs you. They are quite slow at 6 [[speed]] however, however - [[Elbereth]] can be useful to drive them off and kite them, and you can also teleport yourself if grabbed, allowing you to escape or else prepare a means of fighting back (e.g. with a [[wand of cold]] or [[silver]] weapon).

In Gehennom where they normally occur, they are not as much of a threat - most players at this point will have a silver weapon or two, a few methods to deal cold damage, and better AC themselves along with a much more reliable hit-rate.

==History==
The pit fiend is introduced alongside many other major demons in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Origin==
The pit fiend originates from the 1st edition of ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where it is a type of greater devil that primarily occupies the ninth and deepest layer of hell.

Originating as the personal servants of [[Asmodeus]], pit fiends were the most powerful of the non-unique devils and acted as elite overseers of Hell itself. They were hulking, scale-armored humanoids with a pair of massive bat-like wings, fearsome claws, venomous fangs, and prehensile tails - pit fiends fought using these natural abilities alongside others that included cloaking themselves in flames or an aura of fear, turning themselves invisible, and various forms of creating and manipulating flame. A pit fiend was tyrannical and narcissistic: they were capable of cunning beyond measure and expert at terrifying lesser devils and mortals alike, though they were also prone to hubris and could not conceive the possibility of failure. Pit fiends could surpass their already mountainous power with training, and the greatest were promoted beyond the normal ranks into dukes, a unique form of devil with its own special abilities. 

Pit fiends were made from worthy [[ice devil]]s or [[erinyes]] who were subjected to the devil-scorching hellfire of the Pit of Flame for 1,001 days. Others could be created through the blood of Asmodeus himself: each drop became a greater devil, most often a pit fiend, and such beings had a fanatical loyalty to Asmodeus; they could also spawn lesser devils from their shed blood as well. The Dark Eight was a coven of pit fiend generals who directed Hell's armies and culture, and were in turn kept in line by Asmodeus and the other archdevils.

==Variants==
===Lethe patch===
In the [[Lethe patch]], [[Demogorgon]]'s lair in [[Gehennom (Lethe patch)#Demogorgon's lair|Gehennom]] has four pit fiends - one next to Demogorgon's [[throne]], two others within the fortress, and the fourth guarding the down [[stair]].

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], pit fiends may be generated as tame minions for a [[chaotic]] player at [[experience level]]s 28 to 30 via [[sacrifice]] or [[prayer]].

A pit fiend named Hilvuuloth appears among the assistants of [[One-eyed Sam (SLASH'EM)|One-eyed Sam]].

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], a pit fiend named Hilvuuloth is one of the assistants of [[One-eyed Sam (UnNetHack)|One-eyed Sam]], as with SLASH'EM.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], pit fiends are commander-rank demons that appear in various lairs all over Gehennom, and generate with huge [[trident]]s. The pit fiend's second weapon attack is replaced with a claw attack, and instead of a grabbing attack it has a spellcasting attack and a [[poisonous]] bite that reduces strength.

dNetHack adds a stronger variant in the [[Nessian pit fiend]], which also has a passive attack that deals fire damage to melee attackers - they are the second-strongest non-unique demons in the game. Nessian pit fiends generate with maces and battle-axes, and primarily appear in [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus|Nessus]].

Eight pit fiends known as the Ashmadia (singular "Ashmade") accompany [[Asmodeus]] within his court alongside a Nessian pit fiend known as Asemadeva, the Ninth Ashmade; Asmodeus can also form pit fiends and other demons from his shed blood, although pit fiends will only appear once he has taken very heavy damage. A single "traitor" Nessian pit fiend also appears in the court of Demogorgon within [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats#Demogorgon's palace|his palace]], and [[Mammon]] can take the form of a "green pit fiend".

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], pit fiends are given a single claw attack and a new pit-creation attack in order to "live up to their name".<ref>[https://github.com/tsadok/nhfourk/commit/17ac4d793fe848b7be91224587df2c5d56501950 NetHack Fourk commit 17ac4d7: "Make pit fiends live up to their name."]</ref> Fourk also adds more pit-based puns to the game's message output.

The pit fiend's new attack creates several pits around the target, always including one directly under them; if a square selected for pit creation already has one, it will become a [[hole]]. Most types of non-floor [[terrain]], dungeon features and some kinds of existing traps are exempt from pit creation. Among other things, this makes wielding [[footrice]] [[corpse]]s much more dangerous around pit fiends without [[levitation]] or [[flight]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], a different type of pit-creation attack inspired by Fourk is given to pit fiends, replacing their grabbing attack from vanilla.<ref>[https://github.com/copperwater/xNetHack/commit/d027e7b307d7433721b469ebb1df8f531387d686 xNetHack commit d027e7b: "Give pit fiends a pit-creation attack"]</ref> The attack has them stomp the ground to create a pit right under you, then grab and throw you into it; if the attempt to create a pit fails (usually due to the square in question being ineligible), the pit fiend "looks rather piteous".

Preexisting pits may rarely turn into holes; while the attack only works on "normal" terrain types, preexisting traps generally do not block the attack. Levitating or flying does not block the attack either, but you will avoid any damage taken from the pit itself and immediately float out of it. 

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the pit fiend's base experience is adjusted, and they now have a slightly higher speed of 9. Pit fiends in EvilHack can also stomp to create pits, with the implementation borrowed from xNetHack; pit creation occurs randomly {{frac|2}} of the time, with the damage increased to 4d4.<ref>[https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/commit/8a2d4cd476e3ffd87d41c83c34b61e6027524eb6 EvilHack commit 8a2d4cd: "Give pit fiends a pit-creation attack." ]</ref> 

The second-tier demon lord [[Mephistopheles]] has a pit fiend among his servants if he appears in [[Gehennom]].

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM changes, the [[Undertaker quest]] in [[SlashTHEM]] has pit fiends as the second [[quest]] monster.
